item.title: ArchDaily & Strelka Award: Vote to Decide the Winners
item.dc:creator: AD Editorial Team
item.description: Readers of ArchDaily and Strelka Mag have selected a shortlist of 15 architectural projects nominated for the joint ArchDaily & Strelka Award, which celebrates emerging architects and new ideas that transform the contemporary city. The second stage of voting, which will last until August 15, will decide the three winners.
item.content:encoded:
Readers of ArchDaily and Strelka Mag have selected a shortlist of 15 architectural projects nominated for the joint ArchDaily & Strelka Award, which celebrates emerging architects and new ideas that transform the contemporary city. The second stage of voting, which will last until August 15, will decide the three winners.

Vote Here


Read more »

item.title: Clinic School FVS / Lins Arquitetos Associados
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tapia
item.description: The School Clinic for psychology and physiotherapy of the Vale do Salgado College is located in the city of Icó, which lies in an architectural site that dates back to the 18th century. It is encompassed by the dry steppe-like climate of the state of Ceará. Being located at the limit of the heritage perimeter, the building had to comply with some guidelines imposed by IPHAN, Brazil’s federal government heritage register. The guidelines include following the city's color palette, using local materials on the facades, a maximum height of 7 meters, and setting the building at the very limit of the land plot, without any frontal recoil.
item.content:encoded:
• Design Team: Lins Arquitetos Associados
  • Location: Av. Nogueira Acioly - Centro, Icó - CE, 63430-000, Brazil
  • Category: University
  • Lead Architect: Cintia Lins, Deborah Lins, George Lins
  • Area: 3948.52 m2
  • Project Year: 2016
  • Photographs: Joana França

Read more »

item.title: Estrela Doce Bakery / Sónia Triguinho
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tapia
item.description: Located over 20 years on the 25th April Street in the village of Sertã, Estrela Doce Bakery has just opened a new space on the same street but with a totally renewed image in a 125 m2 area. Considered a must-see reference in the Beira Interior region, the present owners took a step forward not only in product manufacturing but also in the space, always aiming to maintain its close relationship with customers inviting those responsible for their success to feel at home.
item.content:encoded:
• Interiors Architects: Sónia Triguinho
  • Location: Sertã, 6100, Portugal
  • Category: Interior Design
  • Area: 156.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Mário Jacinto

Read more »

item.title: Department Design Office Wins Keeping Current Competition to Fight Flooding in Miami
item.dc:creator: Eric Baldwin
item.description: The Van Alen Institute and the City of North Miami have announced Department Design Office as the winner of the KEEPING CURRENT competition. The team has been awarded $80,000 to transform a flood-prone lot in North Miami into a community space and storm water management site. The competition aims to reduce the cost of flood insurance, reinvigorate underused communal areas, and promote climate consciousness.
item.content:encoded:
The Van Alen Institute and the City of North Miami have announced Department Design Office as the winner of the KEEPING CURRENT competition. The team has been awarded $80,000 to transform a flood-prone lot in North Miami into a community space and storm water management site. The competition aims to reduce the cost of flood insurance, reinvigorate underused communal areas, and promote climate consciousness.

Read more »

item.title: Donado 2325 Building / Estudio NDG + Lautaro Malnatti
item.dc:creator: Andreas Luco
item.description: Donado 2325 is a multifamily residential building located between two blank walls, 8.66m front by 32m deep. This particular lot presents the building code r2b1, and is located within the new Donado-Holmberg corridor, an area characterized by low density but which has grown significantly in recent years.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Estudio NDG, Lautaro Malnatti
  • Location: Donado 2325, C1430DRS CABA, Argentina
  • Category: Apartments
  • Lead Architects: Natalia Del Giudice, Lautaro Malnatti
  • Area: 400.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Fernando Schapochnik

Read more »

item.title: KPF’s Robinson Tower Opens in Singapore
item.dc:creator: Christele Harrouk
item.description: The Robinson Tower, a 24 000 m² boutique retail and office tower, was inaugurated in Singapore. Designed by the international firm KPF or Kohn Pedersen Fox Associates, and executed in collaboration with Associate Architect A61, the building addresses the cultural and social aspects of the city, creating a singular and refined experience. The tower stands out from its context showcasing novelty in form and function, changing the city’s skyline.
item.content:encoded:
The Robinson Tower, a 24 000 m² boutique retail and office tower, was inaugurated in Singapore. Designed by the international firm KPF or Kohn Pedersen Fox Associates, and executed in collaboration with Associate Architect A61, the building addresses the cultural and social aspects of the city, creating a singular and refined experience. The tower stands out from its context showcasing novelty in form and function, changing the city’s skyline.

Read more »

item.title: Generali Tower / Zaha Hadid Architects
item.dc:creator: Pilar Caballero
item.description: Generali Tower is within the CityLife masterplan that has redeveloped Milan’s abandoned trade fair grounds following the fair’s relocation to Rho Pero in 2005. Located above the new Tre Torri station on Line 5 of the city’s metro system, CityLife opens the 90-acre site to year-round public use for the first time; providing new civic spaces, public parks and residential areas, in addition to shopping districts and corporate offices.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Zaha Hadid Architects
  • Location: Milan, Italy
  • Category: Sustainability
  • Architects : Zaha Hadid Architects
  • Design : Zaha Hadid, Patrik Schumacher
  • Project Team : Shahd Abdelmoneim, Santiago F. Achury, Marco Amoroso, Agata Banaszek, Gianluca Barone, Cristina Capanna, Alessandra Catello, Sara Criscenti, Kyle Dunnington, Alexandra Fisher, H. Goswin Rothenthal, Marco Guardincerri, Subharthi Guha, Luciano Letteriello, Carles S. Martinez, Marina Martinez, Mario Mattia, Peter McCarthy, Giuseppe Morando, Massimo Napoleoni, Raquel Ordas, Annarita Papeschi, Massimiliano Piccinini, Matteo Pierotti, Line Rahbek, Martha Read, Arianna Russo, Luis Miguel Samanez, Mattia Santi, Letizia Simoni, Alvin Triestanto, Roberto Vangeli, Fulvio Wirz
  • Area: 66785.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Hufton+Crow, Luke Hayes, Jacopo Spilimbergo

Read more »

item.title: Coshocton Ray Trace Installation / Behin Ha
item.dc:creator: Paula Pintos
item.description: Behin Ha's Coshocton Ray Traceemploys scrap material from a coated mesh fabric manufacturer to create a temporary installation at a community park in Coshocton, Ohio. The installation engages the community both by involving its members in its construction, and by creating an unexpected point of attraction near the town square. The structure is operated by the Pomerene Center for the Arts as a meeting place for the community over the summer of 2019, at the end of which it is dismantled and sent back to the manufacturer for recycling.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Behin Ha
  • Location: Coshocton, OH 43812, United States
  • Category: Temporal installations
  • Design Team: Behrang Behin and Ann Ha
  • Area: 650.0 ft2
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Brad Feinknopf

Read more »

item.title: Rand Elliott Architects design Oklahoma Contemporary's New Building
item.dc:creator: Christele Harrouk
item.description: Oklahoma Contemporary Arts Center is relocating to a new building in the downtown area, designed by Rand Elliott Architects, a native firm of the city. This exhibition and educational center, originally a community-oriented arts center founded in 1989, will be open to everyone and free of charge, in order to facilitate the public access for art and education.
item.content:encoded:
Oklahoma Contemporary Arts Center is relocating to a new building in the downtown area, designed by Rand Elliott Architects, a native firm of the city. This exhibition and educational center, originally a community-oriented arts center founded in 1989, will be open to everyone and free of charge, in order to facilitate the public access for art and education.

Read more »

item.title: GMP Designs Cubic Towers for Shenzhen
item.dc:creator: Niall Patrick Walsh
item.description: Architekten von Gerkan, Marg und Partner (gmp) has unveiled its design for the China Telling Communications Building, recognized as the winning entry for an international competition. The two high-rise buildings are linked by a shared podium landscape, forming the concept of two floating cubes to symbolize different business sections of China Telling Corp.
item.content:encoded:
Architekten von Gerkan, Marg und Partner (gmp) has unveiled its design for the China Telling Communications Building, recognized as the winning entry for an international competition. The two high-rise buildings are linked by a shared podium landscape, forming the concept of two floating cubes to symbolize different business sections of China Telling Corp.

Read more »

item.title: 18 Screens House / Sanjay Puri Architects
item.dc:creator: Daniel Tapia
item.description: Lucknow city in India has a rich heritage with numerous buildings dating back to the 18th century. The site for this house lies along a busy arterial road and is on the peripheral edge of an extensive plotted development for private homes. The house is planned to allude to the traditional Indian courtyard house in response to the climate of the location. Temperatures in the lengthy summer months are in excess of 35° C, with the sun in the southern hemisphere.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Sanjay Puri Architects
  • Location: Lucknow, India
  • Category: Houses
  • Lead Architects: Nina Puri & Sanjay Puri
  • Area: 8500.0 ft2
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Mr. Dinesh Mehta

Read more »

item.title: West 8 Wins Middle Branch Competition to Revitalize Baltimore's Waterfront
item.dc:creator: Eric Baldwin
item.description: West 8 has won the competition to revitalize the Middle Branch Waterfront in Baltimore, Maryland. The design competition managed and developed by the Parks & People Foundation on behalf of the City of Baltimore and facilitated in coordination with community-based organizations. Working with local partners Mahan Rykiel and Moffatt & Nichol, the team aims to recreate and redefine the blue green heart of Baltimore.
item.content:encoded:
West 8 has won the competition to revitalize the Middle Branch Waterfront in Baltimore, Maryland. The design competition managed and developed by the Parks & People Foundation on behalf of the City of Baltimore and facilitated in coordination with community-based organizations. Working with local partners Mahan Rykiel and Moffatt & Nichol, the team aims to recreate and redefine the blue green heart of Baltimore.

Read more »

item.title: 4 Films to Explore Postmodernism in Architecture and Urbanism
item.dc:creator: Romullo Baratto
item.description: "Films have been studied by architects and other professionals who are interested in the field of architecture and urbanism because they offer a more subtle and responsive perspective of our discipline," Finnish Architect and Professor Juhani Pallasmaa tells us. Through its technical and aesthetical particularities, the cinema can go beyond simple representation to be a powerful instrument for conveying ideas and concepts related to architecture and urban space.
item.content:encoded:
"Films have been studied by architects and other professionals who are interested in the field of architecture and urbanism because they offer a more subtle and responsive perspective of our discipline," Finnish Architect and Professor Juhani Pallasmaa tells us. Through its technical and aesthetical particularities, the cinema can go beyond simple representation to be a powerful instrument for conveying ideas and concepts related to architecture and urban space.

Read more »

item.title: C House / Estudio PKa
item.dc:creator: Clara Ott
item.description: This weekend home is located on the Atlantic coast, in the Costa Esmeralda neighbourhood, 10 km from Pinamar and 500 m from the sea. We sought to animate the house using a path passing through a conifer forest and with different light-collecting courtyards that articulate the spaces. The project is developed on one floor where the central courtyard divides the house into two volumes, one for public use and one for private use. A second courtyard allows connecting with the green from the bedrooms as well, without losing privacy, with a wooden enclosure that generates a rhythm of light and shadow forming the main facade.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Estudio PKa
  • Location: Argentina
  • Category: Houses
  • Lead Architects: Ignacio Pessagno, Lilian Kandus
  • Area: 240.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Alejandro Peral

Read more »

item.title: Sports Center in Turo de la Peira / Anna Noguera + Javier Fernandez
item.dc:creator: Andreas Luco
item.description: The Barcelona City Council held an architectural competition for the landscape planning of an interior urban block and a sports facility consisting of an indoor heated swimming pool and a sports court. The winning proposal was valued for its landscape integration of a singular greened building in an interior urban block and for its commitment to sustainability and respect for the environment.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Anna Noguera, Javier Fernandez
  • Location: Carrer de Sant Iscle, 50, 08031 Barcelona, Spain
  • Category: Recreation & Training
  • Lead Architects: Anna Noguera, Javier Fernandez
  • Area: 4430.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Enric Duch

Read more »

item.title: The Skew House / Thought Parallels
item.dc:creator: Pilar Caballero
item.description: Driving through winding narrow roads in Malapuram district in Kerala, brings us to the site overlooking lush rubber plantation, which is abundantly grown in and around gradual slopes, camouflaging the house from plain view.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Thought Parallels
  • Location: India
  • Category: Houses Interiors
  • Lead Architects: Ar. Nikhil Mohan and Shabna Nikhil
  • Area: 12000.0 ft2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Prashant Bhat Photography

Read more »

item.title: Qianhai NO.3 Primary School / YUANISM ARCHITECTS
item.dc:creator: Collin Chen
item.description: In recent years, with the rapid development in Shenzhen, the intensive use of construction cause an increasing density of urban space. With a series of policies at the same time, the urban population has expanded so rapidly that the demand for academic degrees has increased sharply. Diversified architectural functional requirements for future education lead to an improvement of hardware indicators in school space. Considering the adaption to the development of urban land, population scale, educational concept, school with high FAR(Floor Area Ratio) and high density has become a hotspot and challenge in the design of primary and secondary schools in Shenzhen.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: YUANISM ARCHITECTS
  • Location: Shenzhen, Guangzhou, China
  • Category: Elementary & Middle school
  • Project Leader: Ruiding Cai
  • Architectural Design & Interior Design & Landscape Design: Ruiding Cai, Zhe Wei, Runtong Huang, Xiaolong Wu, Xiaochen Wei, Chunping Yang, Shanwei Li, Weiyong He
  • Construction Drawing: Yue Ma, Xiaona Zeng, Chang Liu, Zhongping Liu, Guoyuan Han, Rong Xie, Jin Tang
  • Area: 33200.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2018
  • Photographs: Qingshan Wu, Kaixing Luo

Read more »

item.title: The Green Island Community Center / Estudio Cavernas
item.dc:creator: Andreas Luco
item.description: At the heart of a municipal waste centre, home to 400 Burmese migrants, lies an island of green and a site where space, power and identity collide. Faced with decades of structural inequality which have denied them access to social and economic opportunities, the migrants in this community have sought refuge in Mae Sot, Thailand where they collect plastic for a nominal profit.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: Estudio Cavernas
  • Location: Mae Pa, Mae Sot District, Tak, Thailand
  • Category: Community center
  • Lead Architects: Juan Cuevas, Yago Cuevas, Denis Amirtharaj
  • Area: 1590.0 m2
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Denis Amirtharaj

Read more »

item.title: Narcisse Beauty Salon / penda
item.dc:creator: 舒岳康 - SHU Yuekang
item.description: As a high-end chain store brand for precision personal skincare in Beijing, Ecnesse is positioned to provide customized beauty and body care solutions for high-end guests. In 2018 when Ecnesse planned to upgrade and renovate its 5 stores in Beijing, it commissioned Penda China to undertake the spatial design of the project.
item.content:encoded:
• Interiors Designers: penda
  • Location: Beijing, China
  • Category: Interior Design
  • Lead Architects: Dayong Sun, Shuyan Wan
  • Design Team: Yi Zhang, Yue Zhu
  • Area: 300~500 sqm
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Zhi Xia

Read more »

item.title: AutoCamp X Suite / M-Rad
item.dc:creator: Pilar Caballero
item.description: AutoCamp’s contemporary and fully accessible X Suites were designed by M-Rad, a Los Angeles-based design team specializing in bespoke design and fabrication. M-Rad designed five luxury accessible mobile units for a picturesque site in Yosemite National Park located in California’s Sierra Nevada mountains.
item.content:encoded:
• Architects: M-Rad
  • Location: AutoCamp Yosemite, 6323 CA-140, Midpines, CA 95345, United States
  • Category: Cabins & Lodges
  • Lead Architects: Matthew Rosenberg
  • Design Team: Patrick Lun, Agustina Alaines, Etienne Serveau, Leah Zeller
  • Area: 275.0 ft2
  • Project Year: 2019
  • Photographs: Kristopher Grunert

Read more »
